item.title: Physical Sovereignty Crisis: Back Pain Flare & Response
item.description:
Summary: Acute back pain flare: care-provider recon showed systemic delays. Decision: book future specialist slot, deploy immediate countermeasures, pivot to root cause via mattress procurement.

Source: Raw Transcripts: Batch 2

Response Layers

  1. Immediate: Diclofenac gel + heating patches (holding actions)
  2. Near-term: Booked specialist slot (Jan 21)
  3. Root cause: Mattress selected (Dibapur RH5 — pending budget after car)

Status

Mattress researched and selected with Council help, but not ordered yet. Everything comes after the new car next month.

item.title: Real-World Connection Protocol (RCP)
item.description:
Summary: Governance filter: ‘Does this build a bridge to Relational or Financial/Professional Sovereignty?’ If not, log as substitution and redirect.

Source: Raw Transcripts TXT: Batches 1–5

The Question

“Does this action build verifiable, material sovereignty—territory I can hold—or is it compensating for something?”

Audit Point

When using any tool (neurochemical, behavioral, time), ask: “Which unmet need is this tool currently compensating for?” Log the answer. Convert guilt into data.

Notes

  • Established Dec 8 as the system’s enforcement layer
  • The final filter for all subsystem output

item.title: Relational Sovereignty: Parallel Track Declaration
item.description:
Summary: Relational Sovereignty declared a pillar equal to financial/professional goals. Authentic connection framed as sovereign priority, not side quest.

Source: Raw Transcripts: Batch 4

Declaration

Relational Sovereignty is a Parallel Build Track. Equal in priority to financial and professional sovereignty.

Meaning

Authentic connection is not a reward for achieving financial stability. It’s a concurrent objective with equal strategic weight.

item.title: Sovereignty Definition: Financial, Professional, Relational
item.description:
Summary: Three pillars used as decision criteria: Financial/Professional Sovereignty and Relational Sovereignty (with enjoyment as an outcome metric).

Source: Raw Transcripts: Batches 1–4

The Three Pillars

Financial Sovereignty

Enough for enjoyment, freedom, culture.

Professional Sovereignty

Freelance/remote work, international mobility, autonomy.

Relational Sovereignty

Authentic connection. A parallel build track, equal in priority to financial and professional goals.

Function

These pillars serve as the decision filter for all actions (RCP).
